intro: Gomesa × amicta, commonly known as the hybrid gomesa, is a perennial flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Gomesa × amicta is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms and is relatively low maintenance once established.
